title: Texas eighth-grader is arrested for bringing loaded 9mm gun to school 'for protection'
text:
An eighth-grade student from Texas has been arrested for allegedly bringing a loaded gun to his middle school in San Antonio.

Other students at Omar Bradley Middle School alerted administrators at 8.30am on Thursday, telling them that a classmate was possibly in possession of a firearm on campus.

School officials tracked down the student in class and discovered a 9mm loaded gun in the boy's pocket.

An eighth-grade student at Omar Bradley Middle School in San Antonio was arrested on Thursday for bringing to class a loaded 9mm gun in his pocket

When asked why he was armed at school, the teen was quoted as saying that he brought the gun 'for protection,' reported the station KSAT.

North East Independent School District police arrested the teen, who has not been named because he is a minor.

According to the district, the boy will face 'serious disciplinary consequences.'

It's unclear at this time whether the eighth-grader will face criminal charges for possession a loaded firearm at school.

'We applaud the students who came forward and alerted the school,' a letter from Principal Brenda Cerroni sent to parents said. 'We are treating this situation with the seriousness it deserves, and we will not tolerate any inappropriate items at our school.'

Some parents have raised questions about the administrators' handling of the situation, specifically, how did it come to pass that other students raised the alarm about the gun's presence on campus, and not school staff.

'Kids talk and sometimes kids are the first to know what is wrong,' NEISD spokesperson Aubrey Chancellor told Fox San Antonio.
description: Students at Omar Bradley Middle School in San Antonio became aware that a classmate had brought a gun to school on Thursday and quickly alerted officials, leading to the boy's arrest.
